alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins; Muhlenberg; Todd; Trigg; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:45AM EST until February 17 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: .Periods of heavy rain are expected to move across the warning area for the rest of the morning and through the afternoon hours. Given the relatively moist ground conditions, much of the rainfall will runoff much quicker than expected, leading the an increased chance for flooding, especially in low-lying and poorly drained locations. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following areas, Caldwell, Christian, Hopkins, McLean, Muhlenberg, Todd, Trigg and Webster. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy rain and scattered thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madisonville, Central City, Providence, Dawson Springs, Calhoun, Sebree, Earlington, Livermore, Nortonville, Clay, Mortons Gap, Dixon, Crofton, Powderly, Graham, Weir, Greenville, Beech Grove, Dunmor and Cobb. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins; Muhlenberg; Todd; Trigg; Webster
